channel.title: Xythax - 317 F2p Replica - Jag API
channel.description:
[center][img]http://xythax.org/images/logo.png[/img] Xythax, the [b]REAL[/b] 317 F2P remake.
[hr][/center]
Xythax is a revolutionary 317 RuneScape Private Server. We're making this in attempt to revive the epic 317 era that we all loved and enjoyed, seeing as all I see on the server status page and such now is just servers that are there for the money. Xythax will be the server to make a change. We're using my base as the server and will have a team of developers working on it whenever they can. This will be the server to look out for in the future, I guarantee you.
[b]What are your plans?[/b] We plan to make an almost exact 317 free to play remake of RuneScape. I realise everyone is a little fed up of seeing remakes everywhere, but this will be one to keep a look out for this will go far. Below are a list of our ideas, not our actual plans. It's too early in the development to actually list them as plans.
[code] Create a full 317 remake. Make it Free to Play to begin with. When people donate, it's for membership, not for items. When they donate, they will get a higher exp rate and possibly a higher drop rate. They may also get a P2P world, after hosting for a while and getting a good playerbase. [/code]
We are open to suggestions, a lot of suggestions, so post below what you guys think will be good for when we open this as a server. As for server content, we have that covered between our development team.
Our developers currently are; [b]Ruby[/b] - Website Developer & Founder.
[b]Rodgerwilco[/b] - Java Developer [b]Eyeownyew[/b] - Java Developer [b]xxxtilllyxxx[/b] - Java Developer [b]KroniKz_[/b] - Java Developer [b]Whackatre[/b] - Java Developer
[b]Loveandpower[/b] - BETA Tester
After this is fully developed and been run for a while, we plan on releasing JAG, the API which we are developing as the entire content of the server, but we will not be releasing the actual server, at least, this is the plan right now.
[hr]
Jag is the API for 317 servers. All content such as quests will be included in the API so that server frameworks can easily use it to their advantage.
Xythax is a new RS2 emulator written almost entirely from scratch (see thanks msg) and the first server to use Jag.
Features : -Netty -Multi-threaded -Event driven -Uses external Jag API which includes content. As you can see below.. the source is more of a skeleton and all content is a simple plugin.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/9emyr.png[/img]
Output from my spare comp. [code] [SYSTEM] Cores: 2 [SYSTEM] Netty Workers: 4 [SYSTEM] Server Threads: 4 [SYSTEM] Memory Allocated: 1748kb / 16252kb [SYSTEM] Startup Time: 5519ms [SYSTEM] Runescape is now Online! Logged in. [/code]
Special thanks to... Hyperion - Graham (Cipher) Some rs2 server - leeched some documentation from you. xEnt - Ripping little memory snippet from catalyst. Mopar RS Wiki for Packet Documentation

The API is meant to be the actual base of a server. Meaning, it will have all of the handlers, most networking, stuff of that sort. The server will use the API and basically just have content.

item.title: Xythax - 317 F2p Replica - Jag API
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:37, topic:435330”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=538050.msg4008412#msg4008412 date=1338914764]

I don’t think any of the programmers in the development are capable enough to complete this feat.[/quote]@tyb: Why aren’t any of them capable of completing this ‘feat’? Show me some of their programming flaws to validate your own point. Stop pulling crap out of your ass.

Jc, I’ll have to make a correction. I do think eyeownyew is a well to do programmer, and that he can do this. Rodgerwilco, I’ve never heard anything of, although in above posts it seems he is trying entirely too hard to sound smart. Lets start with Tilly, while I think he is a decent programmer, he is always getting help from other programmers, such as blakeman. He could complete it, but not on his own. KroniKz_, I have never seen anything from, never seen him help anyone, never seen anything from him. He just kinda showed up out of no where, I just love how he decided to take a swing at me by posting a really immature comeback on my development thread, which just made him seem like a retard in the end. Whackatre, I see him on the forums all the time, never have seen him complete anything. Don’t plan on seeing him complete anything. Now aside from Java development, Ruby Forums Coder, every time I ask someone who you are the answer is always, “scammer”, but, I can’t always base my opinions off of others, so I’m not going to say anything more about you, seeing as I don’t know you.

Asking for help from another programmer who has more knowledge in the field isn’t a bad thing, if they were just spoon feeding that it’s different, but asking for help and get some points to go in the right direction is never a bad thing…[/quote]
It’s not that he asks for help that we’re saying it’s a bad thing, but being spoonfed completely on the question and still not understanding at all what is going on.

As some of you requested, we (we as in the people attacking, I can try to proudly speak on behalf of them) will stand down for a little while and watch you guys. If this turns out to be unsuccessful or in any way any member that we predicted to be unworthy does not complete their task, then we will not rage but just post one thing: “Told you so.”

This whole API stuff is still not making any real sense to me, if you could explain it into more deph, RodgerWilco, that’d be great.

Read full topic

Hey guys, stop pulling crap out of your asses, thanks.

@tyb: Why aren’t any of them capable of completing this ‘feat’? Show me some of their programming flaws to validate your own point. Stop pulling crap out of your ass.

@imsuperman: Really? How so? I don’t believe any of their IQs are under 70. You really cannot call them retards if you have no sufficient evidence of them being unable to program at all. Stop pulling crap out of your ass.

@asshole: Similar to imsuperman, show me some proof of their ‘retardation’ or stop pulling crap out of your ass.[/quote]

I’m not pulling anything out my ass, some of these people on the team might seriously be retarded.

I asked xxxxxxxxxtillyxxxxxxxxx to return every odd number using a loop, and this is his response

5/5/2012 11:26:08 PM Nicholas Armstrong for (int j = 0; j < 0.length; j++) 5/5/2012 11:27:33 PM Nicholas Armstrong if (j == 0; j++ 1 | j == 1; j++2) { 5/5/2012 11:27:41 PM Nicholas Armstrong return;

item.title: Xythax - 317 F2p Replica - Jag API
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:17, topic:435330”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=538050.msg4007820#msg4007820 date=1338844679]
why would there be a core in this API if it’s strictly content?
[/quote]

Great question. I am utilizing separation of concerns and a (with a twist) DDD (Domain driven model). Not only for that reasoning but for a future release. All content can be added by the community and hopefully all content for a f2p - 317 replica will be gathered. This will allow future 317 servers/frameworks to easily have access to a full replica as a simple plugin. In my picture above you can see my skeleton so that my main focus is the Xythax framework, simple for me as all I worry about is performance.[/quote]separation of concerns is implicit in all code, perhaps you could be much more specific about what you’re doing to separate concerns since it’s an umbrella term over everything from methods to dependency injection (and it sounds like something you’re throwing around to appear smart, tyb noticed this too). also performance isn’t everything, the fact that you jumped from generalised design to then saying that performance is a big concern is antithetical and hilarious.

Read full topic

item.title: Xythax - 317 F2p Replica - Jag API
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:33, topic:435330”][quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=538050.msg4008409#msg4008409 date=1338914509]

Why do people bother making f2p remakes / servers in general? You could double your end player base if you add all the content, plus you wouldn’t have to mess around removing the member items, or making them appear as “Member’s object”.

When we get more than 100 members at one time, we will probably open a members world, where all items are available, just like RS.
[/quote]To be honest, I see this as quite pointless. You will release it, wait for a playerbase and then just change the whole server almost because you have so many players. You might as well just have a free play server and member options from the start. Also, how will players acquire member status? Donation, level cap, etc?[/quote]

Member Status will be achieved by 5$ per month, almost like RS again.

Read full topic
